skill.name: terminal-title
skill.description: This skill should be used to update terminal window title with context. Triggers automatically at session start via hook. Also triggers on topic changes during conversation (debugging to docs, frontend to backend). Updates title with emoji + project + current topic.

security_audit.summary: Terminal title utility with shell scripts. Reads one environment variable, sanitizes all inputs, sends ANSI escape sequences to set terminal title. No network calls, no credential access, no file writes outside script execution. Risk is minimal and contained to local terminal manipulation.

content.user_title: Set terminal title with emoji and context
content.value_statement: Managing multiple projects in terminal windows makes it hard to track context. This skill automatically updates your terminal title with emoji, project name, and current topic so you can identify windows at a glance.
actual_capabilities: Sets terminal title with emoji from environment variable plus project name and topic
Auto-detects operating system and runs appropriate script (bash for Unix, PowerShell for Windows)
Sanitizes all inputs to prevent escape sequence injection attacks
Triggers on session start and detects topic changes during conversation
limitations: Requires setting TERMINAL_TITLE_EMOJI environment variable or defaults to ðŸŽ‰ emoji
Needs bash or PowerShell execution permission in Claude Code settings
Does not persist titles across terminal restarts (relies on session start hook)
Topic detection depends on Claude understanding conversation context

use_cases.title: Topic tracking

use_cases.title: Visual workflow

best_practices: Set TERMINAL_TITLE_EMOJI environment variable to your preferred work/fun emoji
Add the bash permission to your ~/.claude/settings.json to avoid prompts
Let Claude detect topic changes automatically rather than invoking manually
anti_patterns: Invoking on every single message rather than only topic changes
Using overly long topic names that truncate in terminal title bar
Not configuring the required bash/pwsh permission in settings.json

faq.question: Which terminals are supported?
faq.answer: Supports any terminal that accepts ANSI escape sequences including iTerm2, Terminal.app, Windows Terminal, and PowerShell.

faq.question: What emoji does it use?
faq.answer: Reads from TERMINAL_TITLE_EMOJI environment variable. Falls back to ðŸŽ‰ if not set.

faq.question: Does it work on Windows?
faq.answer: Yes. The skill detects Windows and runs the PowerShell script instead of bash script.

faq.question: Is my data safe?
faq.answer: Yes. The skill only reads an emoji environment variable and sets terminal title. No data is sent anywhere.

faq.question: Why is title not updating?
faq.answer: Check that you added the bash permission to settings.json and that TERMINAL_TITLE_EMOJI is set in your shell.

faq.question: How is this different from shell prompt settings?
faq.answer: This skill updates the actual window title bar, separate from the shell prompt. Works even when prompt is not visible.
